concept.title: Managing clusters
concept.shortdesc: You can manage Couchbase clusters programmatically by using a ClusterManager object. The ClusterManager class provides methods to create, update, and remove buckets.

section.title: Authentication
section.p: All administrative operations are executed on the special ClusterManager object, which is obtained from the connection object. To get a ClusterManager object, you need to pass cluster-wide credentials.
To check whether a bucket exists, pass its name to the hasBucket() method.

section.title: Creating a bucket
section.p: To create a bucket, first define the bucket attributes in a BucketSettings object, and then pass the BucketSettings object to the insertBucket() method:
section.codeblock: BucketSettings bucketSettings = new DefaultBucketSettings.Builder() .type(BucketType.COUCHBASE) .name("hello") .password("s3cret") .quota(100) // megabytes .replicas(0) .indexReplicas(false) .enableFlush(false) .build(); manager.insertBucket(bucketSettings);
section.p: The name and quota properties are mandatory. By default, the type of the bucket is BucketType.COUCHBASE.

section.title: Updating bucket properties
section.p: All properties of a bucket except the name and type can be updated programmatically via a BucketSettings object. You cannot change the name or type of an existing bucket. If you omit a property from the BucketSettings object, the default value for the omitted property is used. To avoid any inadvertent changes to bucket properties, make sure to set all properties in the BucketSettings object regardless of whether you are changing the value or continuing to use the existing value.
section.codeblock: BucketSettings bucketSettings = new DefaultBucketSettings.Builder() .type(BucketType.COUCHBASE) .name("hello") .password("") .quota(120) // megabytes .replicas(1) .indexReplicas(true) .enableFlush(true) .build(); manager.updateBucket(bucketSettings);

section.title: Removing bucket
section.p: To remove a bucket, pass its name to the removeBucket() method.
